What are the `maxpreconversions` and `initialcontributions` parameters in currency definition, and how do they work in the context of preconversion and currency launching?

The `maxpreconversions` and `initialcontributions` parameters are important settings in the definition of a currency on the Verus platform.

**`maxpreconversions`:**
The `maxpreconversions` parameter sets a maximum amount of preconversions that can be made during the preconversion time frame. This means that during the preconversion period, the amount set in `maxpreconversions` cannot be exceeded. Any attempts to preconvert amounts above this limit will be automatically refunded after the currency is launched.

For example, in the currency definition:
```
definecurrency '{
 "name":"CoinCommunity", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "maxpreconversion":[100], 
 "initialsupply":100
}'
```
The `maxpreconversion` is set to 100, which means that during the preconversion time frame, people can convert VRSCTEST into CoinCommunity reserves, but only up to a maximum of 100 VRSCTEST. Any attempts to preconvert more than 100 VRSCTEST will be refunded after the currency is launched.

**`initialcontributions`:**
The `initialcontributions` parameter allows the rootID (the creator of the currency) to make an initial contribution to either the reserves of a basket currency (options:33) or to the rootID itself when it's a simple token currency (options:32). The funds to initially contribute need to be in the rootID when defining the currency.

For example, in the currency definition:
```
definecurrency '{
 "name":"CommunityBasket", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest","CoinCommunity"], 
 "initialcontributions":[10,200], 
 "initialsupply":100, 
 "preallocations":[{"Jane@":100},{"John@":50}]
}'
```
The `initialcontributions` parameter is set to `[10,200]`, which means that the rootID is contributing 10 VRSCTEST and 200 CoinCommunity to the reserves of the CommunityBasket currency. At the moment of broadcasting the currency to the network, the rootID needs to have 210 VRSCTEST and 200 CoinCommunity in its wallet. After the preconversion time frame is over and the currency is launched, the rootID will receive an amount of the launched currency, in this case, 100 CommunityBasket.

In summary, `maxpreconversions` sets a limit on the amount of preconversions that can be made during the preconversion time frame, while `initialcontributions` allows the rootID to make an initial contribution to the reserves of a basket currency or to itself when it's a simple token currency.

“maxpreconversions”
Use this parameter to set a maximum amount of preconversions. During the preconversion time frame the amount set can not be exceeded. Everything above this amount will be automatically refunded after the currency is launched.
Example currency:
definecurrency '{
 "name":"CoinCommunity", 
 "options":33, 
 "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "maxpreconversion":[100], 
 "initialsupply":100
}'
🔍 This is a basket currency called CoinCommunity. During the preconversion time frame people can convert VRSCTEST into its reserves for 100 CoinCommunity in return. During the preconversion time frame there can not be more than 100 VRSCTEST converted into its reserves. Whatever is preconverted more will be returned.
“initialcontributions”
The rootID can contribute some or all of the minimum preconversions directly as part of the currency definition. Use this parameter to make an initial contribution to either the reserves when it’s a basket currency (options:33), or to the rootID when it’s a simple token currency (options:32).
The funds to initially contribute need to be in the rootID when defining the currency. After the preconversion time frame is over and the currency launched, the rootID has received an amount of the launched currency.

 "name":"CommunityBasket",

 "initialcontributions":[10,200], 
 "initialsupply":100, 
 "preallocations":[{"Jane@":100},{"John@":50}]
}'
🔍 This is a basket currency called CommunityBasket. The launcher of the currency wanted to make initial contributions to its reserves. At the moment of broadcasting the currency to the network, there needed to be 210 VRSCTEST and 200 CoinCommunity in the rootID.
